item.description:
Explore art photography with a major exhibit at the MFA on a free Wednesday evening.

“Conversations features portraits, still lifes, landscapes, documentary images, and experimental abstractions by more than 100 different artists, grouped thematically to create visual “conversations.” Nineteenth-century works are compared with modern, European juxtaposed with American, close-ups paired with distant views, and staged subjects alongside documentary."  A number of truly great photographers are represented in the exhibit.
http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/conversations

If there's time and energy, we can also view a second wonderful, one-gallery, exhibit (I've seen it a couple of times now):

"Modernist Photography 1910–1950" features approximately 40 American modernist photographs." The show includes "prints by well-known artists, including Alfred Stieglitz, Edward Steichen, Paul Strand, and Walker Evans, . . . Charles Sheeler, Edward Weston, and Ansel Adams—along with work by highly inventive, but less well-known names."
http://www.mfa.org/exhibitions/modernist-photography-1910-1950

Wednesday evenings after 4pm are pay what you choose (or free) nights. We'll meet at 6:30pm inside the lobby at the Hungtington Street entrance.  If you're later than about 10 minutes, find us in the "Conversations" exhibit. Since it's a "school" night, we probably won't go out afterwards. If anyone is interesting in gathering for an early dinner before, say so in your rsvp or send me an email.

Directions to the MFA: http://www.mfa.org/visit/getting-here

(co-listed with the Boston Photo Peeps)
item.how_to_find_us: Inside the lobby at the Hungtington Street entrance. If you're later than about 10 minutes, find us in the "Conversations" exhibit.
item.name: Photography "Conversations" at the MFA
